participant_1.background:
I can't do a lot of things that other people can do because I'm in a wheelchair, but I try to stay positive and make the best of my situation.
my daughters say i am a great mother.
I love wearing clothes that make me feel like I can take on the world.
i used to wear a cape.
I love to grow sunflowers.

participant_2.background:
I spent a few hours yesterday planning my next garden project.
i work part time in the campus library.
i used to be a meat eater but i am now a vegan.
I treasure my ability to swim.
i live in toronto , canada.

content.text: Hi! What are you up to today?
I'm working part time at the campus library and planning my next garden project. How about you?
I love gardening! I spent a few hours yesterday planning my next garden project as well. I'm in a wheelchair so I have to be a little more creative with my gardening but it's still a lot of fun.
That's awesome! I'm impressed that you garden in a wheelchair. I'm sure you get really creative with it. I'm not sure what I'm going to plant yet but I'm thinking of doing a sunflower patch.
Sunflowers are beautiful! I love them. I used to wear a cape when I was little and pretended to be a sunflower.
That's so cute! I love that. I used to love playing make believe when I was little.
Me too! It was so much fun. I wish I could still do it but I don't have a lot of time for it anymore.
I understand. I have to be careful about how much I spend on my hobbies because I'm a student.
That's tough. I'm lucky that I have a lot of support from my family.
I'm lucky that I have a great job and I'm able to save money.
That's awesome! I'm glad you're doing well.
Thanks! I'm glad you are too
